newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Unilever declares Lyons Irish bid final.
newsitem.headline: Unilever declares Lyons Irish bid final.

text.p: Unilever NV -Plc said on Tuesday its offer of 323.3 Irish pence, with a loan note alternative, per share for Lyons Irish Holdings Plc (LIH) is final and will not be raised.

"The offer, which has remained unchanged since first made public, is considered by Unilever Ireland to be fair and reasonable, taking full account of the value of LIH," the Anglo-Dutch food to detergents group said in a statement.
"Unilever has no intention of making a new offer in the foreseeable future and accepts that there may continue to be a minority shareholding in LIH," it added.
Earlier this year, Unilever bought a 75 percent stake in LIH, Ireland's leading tea producer, from Allied Domecq Plc after which it offered 323.3 Irish pence for the remaining shares.
But Lyons Irish repeatedly rejected the bid, which valued LIH at a total of about 97 million Irish pounds or 268 million guilders, saying it was "inadequate".

Unilever spokesman Tom Gordijn said that after the bid for the remaining shares less than one percent of the Lyons Irish shares had been tendered so that Unilever's interest had not changed much since buying the 75 percent stake.
Unilever said the offer will remain open until Friday, November 29, when the bid will close at 1400 GMT.
